result.reason: Supporting Windows High Contrast mode is essential for accessibility and ensures the application remains usable for users relying on system-level accessibility themes.
result.approach: Detect `SystemInformation.HighContrast` at startup and upon system preference change events. If High Contrast is enabled, force the DockPanel suite and other UI elements to use a compatible theme (e.g., a system-native theme or a specific High Contrast theme definition) instead of the default VS2015 themes, ensuring text and background colors align with `SystemColors`.
